api

Interface Task<R>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - type of REsult to expect
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RamseyTask, TaskClosure, TaskCompareTsp, TaskTsp

    public interface Task<R>
extends Serializable
    Defines a basic computation task on the system.
    Author:
    Michael Nekrasov, Roman Kazarin

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCriticalLengthOfParent(double timeInf)
      Sets the runtime of worst performing execution path to this task in DAG
      Result<R> call(SharedState currentState, ComputerCallback<R> callback)
      Called by Computer to execute this task
      String getName()
      Gets the name of the task Useful for tracing through the system Ex: Add, Compare, TSP, Fibbinachi, Ramsey, etc..
      int getPriority()
      Gets the priority of this Task (Used by some schedulers to priorities execution)
      int getTargetPort()
      Get the target port this task will send output to
      long getTargetUid()
      Gets the UID of the target task that this task should send output to
      long getUID()
      Gets the assigned Unique ID of this task
      boolean isReady()
      Have all the inputs and conditions been met for this task to execute
      boolean isSpaceRunnable()
      Should this task be run on Space (Only implemented on certain scheduleres)
      void setInput(int num, Object value)
      Sets an input on this task
      void setTarget(long targetUid, int targetPort)
      Sets the target of the task in a DAG
      void setUid(long uid)
      Sets the Unique Idetifier of this space (called by Space)
      void updateState(SharedState updatedState)
      Updates the known state in the executing task

    • Method Detail

      • isReady

        boolean isReady()
        Have all the inputs and conditions been met for this task to execute
        Returns:
        true if task is ready for execution

      • setTarget

        void setTarget(long targetUid,
             int targetPort)
        Sets the target of the task in a DAG
        Parameters:
        targetUid - UID of task to send output to
        targetPort - input slot of Target task to send output to

      • setInput

        void setInput(int num,
            Object value)
        Sets an input on this task
        Parameters:
        num - slot
        value - to set to

      • addCriticalLengthOfParent

        void addCriticalLengthOfParent(double timeInf)
        Sets the runtime of worst performing execution path to this task in DAG
        Parameters:
        timeInf - runtime sum to this point

      • setUid

        void setUid(long uid)
        Sets the Unique Idetifier of this space (called by Space)
        Parameters:
        uid - to set

      • getUID

        long getUID()
        Gets the assigned Unique ID of this task
        Returns:
        the UID

        Gets the UID of the target task that this task should send output to
        Returns:

      • getTargetPort

        int getTargetPort()
        Get the target port this task will send output to

      • call

        Result<R> call(SharedState currentState,
             ComputerCallback<R> callback)
        Called by Computer to execute this task
        Parameters:
        currentState - at the time it is called (updated via UpdateState() method)
        callback - for sending partial results back to computer
        Returns:
        a final Result back to the space

      • updateState

        void updateState(SharedState updatedState)
        Updates the known state in the executing task
        Parameters:
        updatedState -

      • getPriority

        int getPriority()
        Gets the priority of this Task (Used by some schedulers to priorities execution)
        Returns:
        priority (greater value is higher priority)

      • isSpaceRunnable

        boolean isSpaceRunnable()
        Should this task be run on Space (Only implemented on certain scheduleres)
        Returns:
        true if runnable of the space

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of the task Useful for tracing through the system Ex: Add, Compare, TSP, Fibbinachi, Ramsey, etc..
        Returns:
        the name
